result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

4:03 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan A. Shervey in court for Svetlana Paige Faragher. Defendant Svetlana Paige Faragher in court. Court addresses DE on how things are going. DE states new agent Natalie Volz. Court addressed Bob S. Bob makes statements stating DE is doing well. DE has had police contact and 1 positive ETG test. Court makes statements. Atty Shervey states psych evaluation is not completed due to changing agents and trying to get a referral. Court sets PRH. Adjourned 014:12 PM
Probation review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Probation review hearing on December 5, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

3:09 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan A. Shervey in court, Defendant Svetlana Paige Faragher in court. Court reviews case. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial. ADA Brekken recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads  N/C to Count 1: Expose Child to Harmful Material- 948.11(2)(a)- 1 Year DJOC and Guilty to Count 2: Possession of THC- 941.41(3g)(e).Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses and reads-in Count 3-6. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
Count 1: 1 Year DJOC

Count 2: W/S 1 Year Probation

- 45 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. 
- DNA Sample 
- AODA within 30 days and follow through with recommendations
- Psychological Evaluation within 30 days and follow through with recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Participate in Restorative Justice Program
- Comply with the terms in 22JC23
- Comply with the terms in DJOC
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by 03:00 PM on 07/06/22.

Bail/bond hearing on March 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

- Defendant to test clean besides THC. 

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, P.L.H. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing.
